intro: Gymnadenia triphylla, commonly known as the three-leaf orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of fragrant, pink or lilac flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, thriving in well-drained soils. Gymnadenia triphylla is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its habitat.
